"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Taking logarithms across the last inequality in (1), we obtain;"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{\ln(1+a_k x^n)}{n} \leq \ln(x) + \dfrac{\ln(1+a_k )}{n} \leq \ln(x) + \ln(1+a_k)"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"from which it follows that:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\prod_{k=1}^m \dfrac{\ln(1+a_k x^n)}{n} \leq \prod_{k=1}^m (\ln(x) + \ln(1+a_k))"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"By Lebesgue's Dominated Convergence Theorem, we can bring the limits inside the integral ; then we apply (2) as follows:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"L_m = \int_1^e \lim_{n \to \infty} \prod_{k=1}^m \dfrac{\ln(1+a_k x^n)}{n} dx = \int_1^e \prod_{k=1}^m \lim_{n \to \infty} \dfrac{\ln(1+a_k x^n)}{n} dx = \int_1^e (\ln(x))^m dx \quad ...(3) "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Next, we'll integrate it by parts to obtain at the recurrence relation:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large{L_m = e - mL_{m-1}} \quad ...(4)"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Finally, we'll use induction on "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to show that (with the appropriate initial condition) the solution to the recurrence in (4) is given by;"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large{L_m = (-1)^{m+1} m! + e \sum_{k=1}^m (-1)^k \dfrac{m!}{(m-k)!}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\Longrightarrow \large{L_m = (-1)^{m+1} m! + (-1)^m eD_m}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"D_m"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the number of derangements of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1,2, \ldots ,m"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

\\ & = \int_1^e \prod_{k=1}^m \left({\color{#3D99F6}\lim_{n \to \infty} \frac {\ln \left(1+a_kx^n \right)}n} \right) dx & \small \color{#3D99F6} \text{For }x > 1 \text{, a }\infty/\infty \text{ case, L'Hôpital's rule applies.}
\\ & = \int_1^e \prod_{k=1}^m \left({\color{#3D99F6}\lim_{n \to \infty} \frac {a_k\ln x \cdot x^n}{1+a_kx^n}} \right) dx & \small \color{#3D99F6} \text{Differentiating up and down w.r.t }n
\\ & = \int_1^e \prod_{k=1}^m \left({\color{#3D99F6}\lim_{n \to \infty} \frac {a_k\ln x}{\frac 1{x^n}+a_k}} \right) dx & \small \color{#3D99F6} \text{Dividing up and down by }x^n
\\ & = \int_1^e \prod_{k=1}^{\color{#3D99F6}7} \ln x \ dx & \small \color{#3D99F6} \text{Putting }m=7
\\ & = \int_1^e \ln^7 x \ dx  & \small \color{#3D99F6} \text{Let }u = \ln x \implies e^u \ du = dx
\\ & = \int_0^1 u^7 e^u \ du & \small \color{#3D99F6} \text{By repeated integration by parts}
\end{aligned} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{aligned} \ln (1+z) & = z - \frac {z^2}2 + \frac {z^3}3 - \frac {z^4}4 + \frac {z^5}5 - \cdots & \small \color{#3D99F6} \text{Putting }z = i
\\ \ln (1+i) & = i + \frac 12 - \frac 13i - \frac 14 + \frac 15i - \cdots & \small \color{#3D99F6} \text{Taking the imaginary part}
\\ \Im (\ln(1+i)) & = 1 - \frac 13 + \frac 15 - \frac 17 + \frac 19 - \cdots
\end{aligned} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{aligned} \sum_{m=0}^\infty \frac {(-1)^m}{2m+1} & = \Im (\ln(1+i)) 
\\ & = \Im \left(\ln \left(\sqrt 2 \left({\color{#3D99F6}\cos \frac \pi 4 +i\sin \frac \pi 4}\right)\right)\right) & \small \color{#3D99F6} \text{By Euler's formula}
\\ & = \Im \left(\ln \left(\sqrt 2 {\color{#3D99F6}e^{\frac \pi 4 i}}\right)\right) 
\\ & = \Im \left(\frac 12 \ln 2 + \frac \pi 4 i\right) 
\\ & = \frac \pi 4
\end{aligned} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Similarly,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{aligned} \frac 12 \ln \left(\frac {1+z}{1-z}\right) & = z + \frac {z^3}3 + \frac {z^5}5 + \frac {z^7}7 + \frac {z^9}9 + \cdots & \small \color{#3D99F6} \text{Dividing both sides by }z
\\ \frac 1{2z} \ln \left(\frac {1+z}{1-z}\right) & = 1 + \frac {z^2}3 + \frac {z^4}5 + \frac {z^6}7 + \frac {z^8}9 + \cdots & \small \color{#3D99F6} \text{Putting }z=\sqrt i

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Implying "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle \sum_{n=0}^\infty \left(\frac {(-1)^n}{4n+1} + \frac {(-1)^n}{4n+3} \right) = \Re \left(\frac 1{2\sqrt i} \ln \left(\frac {1+\sqrt i}{1-\sqrt i}\right)\right) + \Im \left(\frac 1{2\sqrt i} \ln \left(\frac {1+\sqrt i}{1-\sqrt i}\right)\right)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{aligned} \frac 1{2\sqrt i} \ln \left(\frac {1+\sqrt i}{1-\sqrt i}\right) & = \frac 1{2\sqrt i} \ln \left(\frac {(1+\sqrt i)(1+\sqrt i)}{(1-\sqrt i)(1+\sqrt i)}\right) 
\\ & = \frac 1{2\sqrt i} \ln \left(\frac {(1+2\sqrt i + i)(1+i)}{(1- i)(1+i)}\right) 
\\ & = \frac 1{2\sqrt i} \ln \left(\color{#3D99F6}\sqrt i + i + i \sqrt i \right) & \small \color{#3D99F6} \text{By Euler's formula}
\\ & = \frac 1{2\sqrt i} \ln \left(\color{#3D99F6}e^{\frac \pi 4 i} + e^{\frac \pi 2 i} + e^{\frac {3\pi}4 i} \right) 
\\ & = \frac 1{2\sqrt i} \ln \left(\color{#3D99F6}\frac 1{\sqrt 2}+0-\frac 1{\sqrt 2} + i\left(\frac 1{\sqrt 2}+1+\frac 1{\sqrt 2} \right) \right) 
\\ & = \frac 1{2\sqrt i} \ln \left(\left(1+\sqrt 2 \right)i \right) 
\\ & = - \frac {i\sqrt i\ln \left(\left(1+\sqrt 2 \right)e^{\frac \pi 2i}\right)}2
\\ & = \frac {(1-i)\left(\ln \left(1+\sqrt 2 \right) + \frac \pi 2i\right)}{2\sqrt 2}
\\ & = \frac 1{2\sqrt 2}\left(\frac \pi 2 + \ln(1+\sqrt 2) + i \left(\frac \pi 2 - \ln(1+\sqrt 2) \right)\right) 
\end{aligned} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore, "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{aligned} \sum_{n=0}^\infty \left(\frac {(-1)^n}{4n+1} + \frac {(-1)^n}{4n+3} \right) & = \Re \left(\frac 1{2\sqrt i} \ln \left(\frac {1+\sqrt i}{1-\sqrt i}\right)\right) + \Im \left(\frac 1{2\sqrt i} \ln \left(\frac {1+\sqrt i}{1-\sqrt i}\right)\right)
\\ & =  \frac 1{2\sqrt 2}\left(\frac \pi 2 + \ln(1+\sqrt 2) \right)  +  \frac 1{2\sqrt 2}\left(\frac \pi 2 - \ln(1+\sqrt 2)\right) 
\\ & = \frac \pi {2\sqrt 2}
\end{aligned} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Finally, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle \sum_{m=0}^\infty \frac {(-1)^m}{2m+1} \sum_{n=0}^\infty \left(\frac {(-1)^n}{4n+1} + \frac {(-1)^n}{4n+3} \right) = \frac \pi 4 \cdot \frac \pi {2\sqrt 2} = \frac {\pi^2}{8\sqrt 2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\implies a+b+c = 2+8+2 = \boxed{12}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"
